problem_text:
20.91. A group G is said to be stable if for any first-order formula ϕ(¯x, ¯y) (in the first-order language of groups { · , −1, 1}) there exists a natural number n such that whenever there exist sequences of tuples of G, (ai)i<m, (bi)i<m with G |= ϕ(ai, bj) if and only if i < j, then m ⩽ n. Sela proved that all torsion-free hyperbolic groups are stable.
a) Is there a non-stable hyperbolic group?
b) Is there a non-stable virtually free group?
c) Is SL2(Z) non-stable?
R. Sklinos
